snippet: Somalia said Friday that a foreign investigative team hired by the government had rebutted allegations of financial mismanagement by United Nations monitors.
abstract: Somalia claims that foreign investigative team hired by government has rebutted United Nations report charging that country's central bank functions as a slush fund; charges of corruption have made it difficult for Somalia's new government to receive money from donors and reclaim overseas assets.
lead_paragraph: Somalia said Friday that a foreign investigative team hired by the government had rebutted allegations of financial mismanagement by United Nations monitors.

headline.main: Somalia: Government Says Report Rebuts Fiscal Mismanagement Charges
headline.print_headline: Somalia: Government Says Report Rebuts Fiscal Mismanagement Charges
